snippet: The official said the most dangerous materials would be sealed and sent to the Mediterranean port of Latakia, where ships would take them to a second foreign port.
abstract: United Nations official in charge of coordinating disposal of Syria’s chemical weapons arsenal provides new details about plan to eliminate them, saying most dangerous materials will be sealed by trained Syrians and sent overland to country’s Mediterranean port of Latakia, where ships would take them to a second, unspecified foreign port.
lead_paragraph: The official said the most dangerous materials would be sealed and sent to the Mediterranean port of Latakia, where ships would take them to a second foreign port.

headline.main: U.N. Official Details Plans for Removing Syria’s Chemical Arms
headline.print_headline: New Details on Removing Unsafe Materials From Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
